By 13 August, the first full day that MLS was operated in science mode, confined diabatic descent inside the polar vortex has led to low values of the long-lived tracer N2O, but high values of species such as HNO3, H2O, HCl, and O3, whose concentrations increase with altitude in the lower stratosphere. In the coldest part of the vortex, however, gas-phase HNO3 and H2O have been substantially depleted as polar stratospheric clouds (PSCs) have formed
